subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Thursday, May 17, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Deal reached on Senate immigration bill

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- After three months of
negotiations, a bipartisan group of senators said Thursday they
have crafted an immigration bill that would give the estimated
12 million undocumented immigrants a path to citizenship.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/deal-reached-on-senate-immigration-bill.html

***

Bush, Blair defend each other's
records

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- In his final
weeks as prime minister of Britain and at what is likely to be
his final news conference in the White House Rose Garden, Tony
Blair expressed no regrets Thursday for the steadfast support
of President Bush's policy on Iraq that has cost him dearly at
home.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bush-blair-defend-each-others-records.html

***

Dems seek no-confidence vote on
Gonzales

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Democratic
senators Thursday called for a no-confidence vote in Attorney
General Alberto Gonzales after this week's testimony that he
sought to get around earlier Justice Department objections to a
controversial eavesdropping program.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/dems-seek-no-confidence-vote-on.html

***

Justice: List for possible firings 'thoughts for
discussion'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Justice
Department acknowledged Thursday that as many as 26 U.S.
attorneys were on lists for potential dismissal during the past
two years, but said the lists were only "thoughts for
discussion" by a now-departed aide to Attorney General Alberto
Gonzales.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/justice-list-for-possible-firings.html

***

Bush expresses resignation over Wolfowitz's
fate

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- President Bush
expressed regret and resignation Wednesday about the fate of
Paul Wolfowitz, and did not repeat his expression of support
for embattled World Bank president remaining at his post.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bush-expresses-resignation-over.html

***

Iraq war funding headed to negotiating
table

WASHINGTON (AP) -- A Senate deeply
divided on Iraq agreed Thursday not to try to pass its own war
spending bill just yet, opting instead to resolve the matter
first with the House behind closed doors.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/17/us.iraq.ap/index.html

***

Gingrich: '08 field
'demeaning the presidency'

RALEIGH, North
Carolina (AP) -- Former House Speaker Newt Gingrich says the
2008 White House candidates are "demeaning the presidency" by
focusing on the race rather than ideas.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gingrich-08-field-demeaning-presidency.html

***

Bill Clinton: I get nervous for
Hillary

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Bill and Hillary
Clinton have been on the political stage for nearly three
decades, but the former president told CNN Wednesday he still
gets nervous when his wife is "in the line of fire."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bill-clinton-i-get-nervous-for-hillary.html

***

Dobson slams Giuliani

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Focus on the Family Chairman James
Dobson will sit out the 2008 presidential election if former
New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani is the Republican
presidential nominee, he writes in an editorial posted at
http://www.worldnetdaily.com. Dobson was specifically critical
of Giuliani's position on abortion and marriage as well as the
former mayor's three marriages.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/dobson-slams-giuliani.html

***

Gore on running: 'I haven't ruled it out'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Vice President Al Gore has
not "ruled out" a presidential bid in 2008, he told Time
Magazine in an interview published Thursday.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gore-on-running-i-havent-ruled-it-out.html

***

'Raw Politics' tonight: Pressure on Gonzales,
deal on immigration, speculation on Gore

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Everyone in Washington knows the rule:
Always kick a man when he's down, because he can't kick back.
And congressional Democrats are kicking Attorney General
Alberto Gonzales very hard, CNN's Tom Foreman reports in
tonight's "Raw Politics."

Meanwhile, more than ten
million illegal immigrants may get a way "in." A bipartisan
plan has been worked out to allow illegal immigrants to earn
citizenship. The measure faces debate in Congress this summer.

And will voters face Al Gore's name on the ballot in
'08?

Catch it all on "Raw Politics," tonight on
Anderson Cooper 360, 10 p.m. ET
